content:
Social Copywriter 
 
About Ogilvy 
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry.
 
About the Role 
We are looking for a Social Copywriter to bring a well-known technology brand to life across all social media channels from acquisition to recognition.
Do you love creating social media content that captures attention and gets someone to stop and take action?  
We’re looking for a talented Social Copywriter who will be responsible for creating and delivering high quality writing across a variety of social platforms. We want someone who can take creative insights and briefs and turn it into design that works and drives impact. 
You will be joining a close-knit team of creatives working together as a collective to create fresh, bold, distinctive and breakthrough social content. This unique opportunity offers the chance to work in close collaboration with the strategic and creative teams of Ogilvy, and with some of the best social and content experts in the industry. 
Your mission: to conceptualize and develop unique and disruptive ideas that are social at heart, and create best-in-class content for social programs and integrated campaigns.
 
What You’ll Do

Be a brand steward of the client’s tone of voice and be able to adapt it for copy on social media channels
Ideate and execute sound creative ideas for client social marketing materials
Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of our client’s brand voice and implement it into all creative jobs
Collaborate with the team to develop and present creative concepts for clients and new business to help build brands
Work closely with art directors and designers to ensure copy tone and style are consistent with visual tone, style, and brand guidelines
Tailor concepts to business objectives and audience demographics
Translate creative direction and copy points from creative briefs into engaging and effective concepts
Proofread and vet copy to ensure consistency in tone, grammar, and messaging before assets are handed over for production or posting
Keep up on global cultural trends and industry updates, integrating this understanding of the landscape into your concepts
Present concepts to internal teams, senior company leaders, and clients

What You’ll Need 

1-2 years' copywriting experience in the digital/social space
Experience with the tech industry is preferred for this role
Strategic and conceptual thinking
Passion for learning and self-improvement
Proactive, positive, and a self-starter
The ability to work efficiently under tight deadlines
Excellent multi-tasking skills and experience working on multiple projects simultaneously
Adaptable and able to handle changes in briefs, priorities, and edits

 
How We’ll Support You
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.
 
Please note: we are operating on a hybrid three day a week in office model. We are not able to consider fully remote candidates for this role.The base salary range for this position at the time of this posting is indicated below. Individual compensation varies based on job-related factors, including location, business needs, level of responsibility, experience, and qualifications. We offer a competitive benefits package, click here for more details.Pay Range$45,000—$90,000 USDAt Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
